Get started with funbiogeo

Source: vignettes/funbiogeo.Rmd
funbiogeo.Rmd
library("funbiogeo")

Introduction…

Data format

…

Sites x Locations

## Load sites x locations example dataset ----
data("sites_locs", package = "funbiogeo")

## Preview ----
head(sites_locs)
#>                   longitude latitude
#> MD_9557550010661  -76.77747 39.72233
#> MD_9565278010661  -79.38865 39.72230
#> NJ_9687057010661  -75.05517 40.36122
#> OH_19104898010661 -80.41646 41.88894
#> PA_10725597010661 -76.94414 40.58342
#> PA_10725883010661 -76.69413 40.44453
## Sites identifiers are row names ----
rownames(sites_locs)[1:10]
#>  [1] "MD_9557550010661"  "MD_9565278010661"  "NJ_9687057010661" 
#>  [4] "OH_19104898010661" "PA_10725597010661" "PA_10725883010661"
#>  [7] "PA_10725971010661" "PA_10726115010661" "PA_10726148010661"
#> [10] "PA_10726179010661"

Sites x Species

## Load sites x species example dataset ----
data("species_occs", package = "funbiogeo")

Species x Traits

## Load species x traits example dataset ----
data("species_traits", package = "funbiogeo")

## Preview ----
head(species_traits)
#>                            sla   n_mass wood_dens
#> acer_negundo          26.91535 2.500345     0.416
#> acer_pensylvanicum    25.26650 2.221025     0.440
#> acer_rubrum           15.88968 1.657609     0.490
#> acer_saccharum        14.21417 1.497401     0.560
#> betula_alleghaniensis 15.62587 1.764643     0.550
#> betula_nigra          11.77449 2.290171     0.490
## Species names are row names ----
rownames(species_traits)[1:10]
#>  [1] "acer_negundo"          "acer_pensylvanicum"    "acer_rubrum"          
#>  [4] "acer_saccharum"        "betula_alleghaniensis" "betula_nigra"         
#>  [7] "betula_papyrifera"     "betula_populifolia"    "carpinus_caroliniana" 
#> [10] "carya_alba"
## Traits names are column names ----
colnames(species_traits)
#> [1] "sla"       "n_mass"    "wood_dens"

Long format

## Path to example raw dataset ----
filename <- system.file("extdata", "raw_trees_data.csv", package = "funbiogeo")

## Read CSV file ----
all_data <- read.csv2(filename)

## Preview ----
head(all_data)
#>                 site            species longitude latitude count     sla
#> 1  PA_76856094010538 acer_pensylvanicum -78.60508 39.91707     7 25.2665
#> 2  PA_68287127010538 acer_pensylvanicum -77.54087 40.35293     2 25.2665
#> 3  PA_76855646010538 acer_pensylvanicum -78.30221 40.18796     4 25.2665
#> 4  PA_58581106010538 acer_pensylvanicum -79.28570 40.04243     2 25.2665
#> 5 PA_145019955010661 acer_pensylvanicum -77.05348 40.37183     3 25.2665
#> 6  PA_10716167010661 acer_pensylvanicum -78.30529 41.02784     1 25.2665
#>     n_mass wood_dens
#> 1 2.221025      0.44
#> 2 2.221025      0.44
#> 3 2.221025      0.44
#> 4 2.221025      0.44
#> 5 2.221025      0.44
#> 6 2.221025      0.44
  • Format sites x locations data
## Format sites x locations data ----
sites_locations <- fb_format_sites_locations(data      = all_data, 
                                             site      = "site", 
                                             longitude = "longitude", 
                                             latitude  = "latitude",
                                             na_rm     = FALSE)

## Object information ----
class(sites_locations)
#> [1] "matrix" "array"
dim(sites_locations)
#> [1] 836   2
## Preview ----
head(sites_locations)
#>                   longitude latitude
#> OH_19104898010661 -80.41646 41.88894
#> PA_10686546010661 -78.22196 40.11119
#> PA_10686882010661 -78.33307 40.19452
#> PA_10688091010661 -78.49974 39.86120
#> PA_10688665010661 -78.47196 40.22230
#> PA_10688975010661 -78.36085 40.08341
## Sites names ----
rownames(sites_locations)[1:10]
#>  [1] "OH_19104898010661" "PA_10686546010661" "PA_10686882010661"
#>  [4] "PA_10688091010661" "PA_10688665010661" "PA_10688975010661"
#>  [7] "PA_10692037010661" "PA_10692419010661" "PA_10692473010661"
#> [10] "PA_10693473010661"
  • Format sites x species data
## Format sites x species data ----
sites_species <- fb_format_sites_species(data       = all_data, 
                                         site       = "site", 
                                         species    = "species", 
                                         value      = "count",
                                         na_to_zero = TRUE)

## Object information ----
class(sites_species)
#> [1] "matrix" "array"
dim(sites_species)
#> [1] 836   3
## Preview ----
head(sites_species)
#>                    acer_pensylvanicum populus_tremuloides quercus_macrocarpa
#> PA_76856094010538                   7                   0                  0
#> PA_68287127010538                   2                   0                  0
#> PA_76855646010538                   4                   0                  0
#> PA_58581106010538                   2                   0                  0
#> PA_145019955010661                  3                   0                  0
#> PA_10716167010661                   1                   0                  0
## Sites names (first ten) ----
rownames(sites_species)[1:10]
#>  [1] "PA_76856094010538"  "PA_68287127010538"  "PA_76855646010538" 
#>  [4] "PA_58581106010538"  "PA_145019955010661" "PA_10716167010661" 
#>  [7] "PA_58581599010538"  "PA_10752222010661"  "PA_10789064010661" 
#> [10] "PA_58581253010538"
## Species names ----
colnames(sites_species)
#> [1] "acer_pensylvanicum"  "populus_tremuloides" "quercus_macrocarpa"
  • Format species x traits data
## Format species x traits data ----
species_traits <- fb_format_species_traits(data    = all_data, 
                                           species = "species", 
                                           traits  = c("sla", "n_mass", "wood_dens"))

## Object information ----
class(species_traits)
#> [1] "data.frame"
dim(species_traits)
#> [1] 3 3
## Preview ----
species_traits
#>                          sla   n_mass wood_dens
#> acer_pensylvanicum  25.26650 2.221025      0.44
#> populus_tremuloides 15.06333 2.027469      0.35
#> quercus_macrocarpa  11.01700 2.302263      0.58
## Species names ----
rownames(species_traits)
#> [1] "acer_pensylvanicum"  "populus_tremuloides" "quercus_macrocarpa"
## Traits names ----
colnames(species_traits)
#> [1] "sla"       "n_mass"    "wood_dens"
